comment: This guy CARES! Professor Wannamaker is easily top 5 teachers of my life. He cares about you, he cares about your grade, he cares about your success. His lectures are a little janky but it's because he's so passionate about what he teaches he can't help but also dive into stuff that doesn't matter, but because he loves it. Don't be late to class

He was a nice guy, but he is a hard professor. He makes you take quizzes but he doesn't go over the material beforehand. The powerpoints were not helpful, and the chapters you didn't finish reviewing in class he would make you review it on your own. The tests were difficult and extremely specific to the textbook. I would not take this class again.

Good history class, I learned a good bit of history I didn't know before. The lectures and assignments teach you a lot. Exams/quizzes can be challenging or easy depending on how he feels that day. The assignments were fun to me, especially the ones where you make a video.

Take this class if you have a true interest/ major in history! Wannamaker helped me learn so much information. I genuinely feel educated after this class unlike others. Prepare to study like crazy for long tests. He's a super kind guy, study hard for the first quiz, it'll help you. It's a heavy load, but worth it if you care. Don't take if ur lazy!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: WORST professor EVER. Took him my first semester at KSU and he gave me the worst experience. He shows no SYMPATHY for his students and their hard work. He told me I didn't "study hard enough" even after spending all night doing it when his notes were nothing like the test. Constantly rambling in class & his power points don't help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I do not recommend his class, because it was difficult and he never helped us understand the material.

Dr Wannamaker is an amazing professor. It is obvious that he cares deeply for his students. He posts reminders/hints often on D2L and responds to emails quickly. He is willing to stay extra hours to do reviews. He gives bonus opportunities to raise your grade. Beware if you aren't looking to put in time and effort he is not the professor for you.

Dr. Wannamaker clearly cares about his students, as he offers frequent hints for exams in every lecture and provides many opportunities to improve one's grade. If you put forth effort, he will always reciprocate and help you in every possible way. I am personally horrible with history, but Dr. Wannamaker made a subject I abhor to a subject I adore.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: BEWARE, he changes for the worse after the drop add period changing the formatting of the test, making it more difficult for students. Make sure to read everything in the textbook because he will not miss anything on the test his test or composed of 100 questions as well as an essay question. And his projects and assignments are extremely lengthy.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Really enjoyed this class. He really cares about his students and you can tell. All tests and quizzes were in class and can be challenging if you're not good at studying, however he is very understanding and easy to get in touch with.

This teacher likes what he teaches, but I would NOT take his course again. I wrote more essays in his class than my actual English class. You take a quiz almost every week and the tests are so long and hard. He is very nice and caring but the workload for this class was more than any class I've ever taken, and I'm a good student and good at history

I took him for AP European History back at Campbell High School my freshman year (before he retired) and the class itself was an easy A (I fortunately ended with a 98). His lecture slides are picture based and his quizzes and tests were application-based. I don't understand how people hate him - he was the best teacher I had in high school.

TERRIBLEEEE! Was overly stressed with his class dropping it was the best decision of my life. He has no compassion for his students. Expects us to LIVE, BREATHE, history like we don't have other classes to worry about. When everyone says his study guides DON'T match his tests THEY MEAN IT. Also, his lectures are him rambling and put you to sleep.

DONT TRUST THE 5 RATINGS. he's dog water. absolutely awful. his teaching is poor, his slides are un-studable, he only yapps about the info, and his tests are way too long and difficult. it's so specific that he'd probably ask you about what the french guy ate on X date. just choose someone else. you know it's bad when he keeps saying not to drop.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Had this professor for my freshman year World History II class and immediately had issues with his class. I've always been good at history and never made less than an A. This class is far different. I don't know one person who didn't get a C in this class. I do NOT recommend taking this class with this professor. Lecture-heavy and a packed schedule

His PowerPoints are horrible, he bounces around slides and it's very difficult to know what to take notes on. The tests were awful, and even caused people to drop the class due to the hit to their grade. This class is not worth your GPA. I've never met a teacher so fine with people failing/dropping a class. He also tested 3 units not yet covered.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Don't take him!!  He was really nice but his tests are sooo hard plus 80 questions long, you would have to understand the powerpoint slides in order to get a good grade on the test, I literally almost dropped because I thought I was going to fail the class. There is also lots of writting and quizzes. Also his slides are all over the place.

Best professor I've had. His lectures and assignments require careful consideration, thought, and effort. It is unlike any other history class you will take. Yes, the class is hard, but he sets you up for success. It's up to you to decide what to do with the tools he gives you. Study hard, read your textbook, show up to class, and you're good.

He was a super sweet guy, but unfortunately not a great professor. His lectures were all over the place and super hard to take notes on. His tests were not about what was taught in class and worded very poorly. He also assigned a lot of homework that was graded very hard. I ended up dropping because my grade was too low.

This professor seems like a really cool guy but if you want to pass the class YOU have to put in the work. His lectures are extremely long and he constantly goes off topic onto other things in order to "make everything connect together" but in the end, it ended up confusing me. The notes he puts on the board aren't enough to prepare you for tests.

My favorite professor so far! Super nice and loves to crack a good dad joke. The class was rigorous but overall very rewarding and he made sure to set everyone up for success. He makes sure you understand the content and provides in depth study guides, extra credit, and great feedback.

Please, PLEASE chose this professor if you want to succeed! He's so passionate about History and is always willing to answer questions, spark debates, and have good, meaningful conversations. He gives great feedback on papers showing his attentiveness to his pupils' learning and was always proactive in mine and my classmate's learning.

Do yourself a favor, if you need to take a history class and Professor Wannamaker is an option, go for it. Professor Wannamaker makes this class very enjoyable through his easygoing attitude, straightforward tests, and grade boosting essays. Every tests has an essay to boost grades, and although tests are long, they are easy to prep for.

He was great, he gave essays to boost test scores that were very easy and graded for completion. Plus you do them on your own time, not in class. His quizzes were short and he almost gave you the questions so with just a little bit of studying you will get a 100. The tests were very hard but that is standard for this subject.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: His lectures are great, you can tell he really knows what he is talking about and enjoys the subject he teaches. He is also very caring and willing to work with students if they need help with anything. Just be warned, his tests are very difficult and require reading of the textbook. Other than that he is awesome.

Mr. Wannamaker is a friendly professor with great intentions for teaching history. Although, sometimes he can get a bit off-topic and go on with sarcastic jokes and dry humor. The class itself is very easy. However, the tests are extremely long around 80 questions. This is ALOT to memorize. Essay sections on the test for completion help boost grade

Informative class - He has PowerPoints that he uploads but will test you on things that are mentioned in the book and not in class. He would take some time talking on topics he liked and then towards the end of the semester or chapter, we would have to do a lot of self-learning for the test which.  Not the worst teacher
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Good lecturer. Explains things well and makes relations between different eras of history. He gives a bunch of writing assignments, but they're relatively easy if you are willing to put in the work. Gives extra quizzes/papers and drops lowest quiz grades. Tests are a little difficult but doing the papers would guarantee a passing grade at least.

Literally one of the worst professors I've ever had while in college. His lectures make absolutely no sense at all. He claims it will relate back at the end but it never does. His lectures make absolutely no sense at all. Do not take him.

Fun teacher, that actually tries to make the topics interesting. Assigns a lot of work, but grades clearly. I recommend If you are willing to put in effort into going to class and studying heavy before tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof was an easy grader and his tests were mostly fair. Has two big papers which are kind of a pain if history isn't an easy/interesting subject for you. I never used the textbook once. Just watch the lectures and quizlet the study terms for the quizes/tests.

Although there is a lot of writing, it is all relatively easy, and he doesn't grade very harshly. He's incredibly understanding of different situations and will always make time to go over something that a student may not understand. He does have a lot of work though.

This course is a bit heavy test-wise (since there's quite a lot of questions on them), however all his test questions are mentioned in his lectures (hence why you should watch the lecture recordings). This prof also cares for his students a lot (TONS of extra cred!!) and makes time to go over study sheets as well.

His lectures are very boring. He takes the entire hour and 15 minutes. He jumps around a lot to make it connect but it never does. His test are 75 multiple choice with short responses. There is also a essay portion. I wouldnt take him again because his test are hard for no reason. He does crack some jokes but that doesnt make up for a hard test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Really amazing professor and funny. I found it engaging when he jumped around from timeline to timeline to connect the events in history. His tests are hard and overwhelming but he claims that there are bonus questions on his test. The two paper projects we had to write were very time-consuming. We also had 5 quizzes that were okay. I.M.S

Great professor with some pretty corny jokes. Have two essays that are kinda big. Tests are a bit overwhelming (75 questions and 5 prompts for the tests and 150 for the final), but there's extra credit and he's willing to help out.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Good professor. Very clear on what he expects. Tests are over what was lectured in class, but worded from the textbook. As long as you follow along, and study a bit, it's an easy class. The essays/projects are fairly easy but take a bit of time. He is a very relaxed grader; gives tons of extra-credit opportunity, and tries to make his lecture fun.

One of my favorite professors in college so far. He jumps around from time to time to connect events but just pay attention, it'll make sense. He makes the 2 essays sound scary at the beginning of the semester but they are not, they're actually interesting and fun. Just apply yourself, do your work and you'll get an A.

This professor is very caring and tries to be funny but he expects you to know everything about history. He has projects that can help boost ur grade and gives a a few extra credit opportunities. If you enjoy history or your good at it i would take him, if not i would try and avoid. Each test has an essay portion besides the final exam.

He's a really nice guy and I enjoyed the class. Attendance is not mandatory but he does do a sign-up sheet and to see who is in class possibly if someone ever needs there grade bumped. There are quizzes and projects but follow instructions and you'll get an A in them. He also offers extra credit assignments. Youll get an A if you work a little!

He is a very sweet man, but a tad bit awkward in my opinion. He gave way too much work for the course level, but he also gave a lot of extra credit.  His tests are essay and multiple choice but he lets you do the essays outside of class, which was great. I would avoid him, but if you don't have the option you'll still be fine.

Easiest class so far in college. Final grade was literally over 100. There are 2 projects you have to do at home but they are easy and easy 100s, and 25% of the final is bonus, I made a 130% on it. He knows everything and highlights and underlines the exact information you need to know for the test; he even brings his own special scantrons for them

Easy, easy, easy quiz grades. 2 Huge projects that are also super easy grades. Just do those and review class notes for the tests and you should be fine. He's a little quirky and a high school teacher, which definitely shows. But it also feels like a high school class. Super nice guy, I'd take him again.

Wannamaker is great professor- he knows what he's talking about and can answer any question and he cares about all his students. BUT there is way too much work- two huge papers and four tests (three have a take home essay portion). The writing is done outside of class so that's not too bad. Wannamaker would not be the worst choice
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: You have 3 tests, 3 papers, and a few quizzes throughout the semester. The papers are the absolute worse and take forever to finish. His tests are also pretty difficult. He goes over a powerpoint in class and describes everything on each slide so it's very note heavy. He is a really nice guy and is more than willing to answer any questions you have

He's possibly one of the best teachers or professors I've had. The lectures contained all or almost all of the information in the tests, though sometimes he would mention a fact as if it wasn't important and it would actually be on the test.
